title: Dea Dia
extract:
Dea Dia ("The Divine Goddess") was a goddess of fertility and growth in ancient Roman religion. She was sometimes identified with Ceres, and sometimes with her Greek equivalent Demeter.

She was worshiped during Ambarvalia, a festival to Ceres. Every May, her priests, the Fratres Arvales, held a three-day festival in her honor.

See also

  • Other goddesses known as Dea ("The Goddess")
  • Other goddesses known as Dia ("The Divine One")
